intro: Stachys dolopica, commonly known as the Armenian betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in whorled spikes, featuring purple to violet petals that bloom in late spring to early summer. Stachys dolopica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
